individual_metadata.synopsis: Gnome slaves Laridda and lunkbug are in a bad state. Lunkbug's lover is trapped behind the wreckage, and Laridda's lover has run off with smokepowder they could use to blast him free - but this could cause problems with their slavers. The player can convince them to tell you where the smokepowder is.This should be a super stressful and anxious conversation.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: To trigger GREETING1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -635.141; 14.738; 3104. Talk with LunkbugTo trigger HASMET1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -635.141; 14.738; 3104. Talk with Lunkbug and leave conversation.5. Talk to Lunkbug again.To trigger REFUSED QUEST1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -635.141; 14.738; 3104. Use recon command: "SetGlobalOsirisFlag UND_ArguingGnomes_Quest_Refused"5. Talk with LunkbugTo trigger FAILED PERSUASION1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -635.141; 14.738; 3104. Select player character and use recon command: "SetCharacterOsirisFlag UND_ArguingGnomes_Event_FailedPersuasion"5. Talk with Lunkbug

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The in-game dialogue sessions can branch from an initial encounter. The GREETING1 session is triggered first when the player meets Lunkbug. After that conversation, the dialogue may branch into one of several distinct outcomes – HASMET1 if the conversation proceeds normally, REFUSED QUEST1 if the quest is refused, or FAILED PERSUASION1 if persuasion fails. Since the player’s choices will lead down only one branch, these three alternative sessions are mutually exclusive – only one can be experienced in a single playthrough. Therefore, GREETING1 must always come before whichever branch is triggered next.

12.speaker: Lunkbug
12.text: Oh Beldron... I'm so sorry. I'll get you out of there. I promise.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: I've got explosive powder. That should open the way.

133.speaker: Lunkbug
133.text: Incredible news. Drop it near the cave-in and set it alight!

158.speaker: Player
158.text: I have news: half the trapped gnomes are already dead.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I found Philomeen. And she wants Laridda to move on.

36.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
36.text: Move on? I gave her everything. And she has the gall to send you to break me?

144.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
144.text: Get us out of here. All of us. And hope for her sake her path never crosses mine again.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Bad news, I'm afraid. Philomeen is - gone.

75.speaker: Lunkbug
75.text: Please - my Beldron is still trapped. Blow that wall open, I'm begging you.

59.speaker: Lunkbug
59.text: Place the powder and use fire to explode it!

87.speaker: Lunkbug
87.text: Get Beldron out of there. Please.

119.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
119.text: Quiet, Lunkbug. The walls have ears.

121.speaker: Lunkbug
121.text: Beldron's still trapped. Find Philomeen and get that smokepowder!

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *The gnomes speak in soft whispers, the words all but lost in the hot air.*

164.speaker: Lunkbug
164.text: We'll never get through. We need that smokepowder.

170.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
170.text: Philomeen's gone. And if she's smart, she won't be coming back.

178.speaker: Lunkbug
178.text: Tell the sergeant where she went - Beldron's still trapped with that maniac Nere!

156.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
156.text: Forget the smokepowder - they'd kill Phil on the spot. I won't let you do it.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Do you mean Philomeen? She's gone now - but she's safe.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Do you mean Philomeen? She's safe. I have the powder.

179.speaker: Player
179.text: Do you mean Philomeen? She's done for. I have the powder.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: I'm a friend - Thulla sent me.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: I heard a gnome escaped. Tell me what you know.

22.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
22.text: No, no... there must be some mistake. Right, Lunkbug?

94.speaker: Player
94.text: The sergeant's defeated. This is your chance to flee.

69.speaker: Lunkbug
69.text: It's my Beldron. He's still back there! I -

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I have news: half the trapped gnomes are already dead.

115.speaker: Lunkbug
115.text: Great gods. How - how could you know that?

96.speaker: Player
96.text: I'm a True Soul. I saw them through Nere's eyes.

174.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
174.text: You - you can do that? I mean of course. Of course, True Soul.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I spoke with their ghosts. Chatty folks, all in all.

182.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
182.text: Ghosts? N-no. That can't be. This must be a joke.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: It doesn't matter. Call it a hunch.

44.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
44.text: A hunch? Just... just a guess, then. Maybe they're all right...

141.speaker: Lunkbug
141.text: Damn it, Laridda. We've lost enough of us. I'm not losing Beldron, too.

116.speaker: Lunkbug
116.text: Hear me out - our friends are trapped in the cave-in. And I know a way to get them out.
116.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda shakes her head at Lunkbug, warning him not to say anything. Lunkbug ignores her and turns to you.

1.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
1.text: Bug, please. True Soul Nere will - you know what he'll do.
1.context: NodeContext: Pleading for her friend not to tell.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: That sounds like quite the drama. I can't wait to watch.

20.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: To LunkbugNodeContext: Pleading with Lunkbug not to say anything.

127.speaker: Lunkbug
127.text: I've... I've got no choice, Laridda. We have to chance it.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Leave the True Soul to me. Now tell me what you know.

172.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
172.context: CinematicNodeContext: To LunkbugNodeContext: Pleading with Lunkbug not to say anything.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: A terrible situation. I'm sure you'll pay handsomely if I help.

112.speaker: Lunkbug
112.text: Found it in the ruins. It's all I've got. Please, just listen.
112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lunkbug gves you revivify scroll but doesn't need to show in cinematic.

27.speaker: Lunkbug
27.text: A few days back, there was a... a scene. Our friend Philomeen, she's a sapper. Set off a blast and ran off.

154.speaker: Lunkbug
154.text: We set a spot for hiding if someone found trouble. I'll mark your map.

45.speaker: Lunkbug
45.text: If Philomeen made it, you'll find her there. She'll have the stuff to blow that tunnel wide open and get Beldron and the rest out.

63.speaker: Lae'zel
63.text: When Thulla said to rescue her friends, I suppose she meant all of them. Waste of time, if you ask me.

184.speaker: Shadowheart
184.text: If we recovered those explosives, we could free Thulla's friends with one blast, then move on.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: Some firepower'll help bust open that wall. Then we can free the poor lads inside.

101.speaker: Astarion
101.text: Well, some explosives would certainly help us free Thulla's friends. They might even survive the blast.

149.speaker: Wyll
149.text: Thulla said to free her friends - all of them. We need to bust that wall open. And those explosives will do the trick.

103.speaker: Gale
103.text: If we're to help Thulla, we'll have to breach that wall with explosives and hope the blast doesn't injure anyone. Or worse.

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: I've no care for these slaves. But explosives that powerful? Those could prove useful.

65.speaker: Shadowheart
65.text: Sounds like an unnecessary risk to me. Though that hasn't stopped us before.

26.speaker: Karlach
26.text: Perfect. Let's get a move on, then.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I've spoken to Philomeen. She's gone now - but she's safe.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Philomeen's safe. I have the powder.

92.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
92.text: She's - she's all right? Thank the Stern himself!

19.speaker: Lunkbug
19.text: But... what of the powder? Without it, Beldron will die in that tunnel.

123.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
123.text: She can't have taken it all with her, Bug - she must have squirreled some away.

82.speaker: Lunkbug
82.text: Please - our people are trapped. Phil was a sapper, kept a smokepowder stash. Find it and blow that wall open, I'm begging you.

51.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
51.text: But the others... they'll die in that tunnel. If not by poison, then by Nere's hand.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Philomeen's done for. I have the powder.

161.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
161.text: No. No - it can't be. I told you, Lunkbug.
161.context: CinematicNodeContext: To LunkbugNodeContext: Upset, incosolable.

67.speaker: Lunkbug
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Laridda, who has broken down and is crying.

9.speaker: Lunkbug
9.text: Our friends are trapped in that tunnel. My Beldron will... will die without help.

88.speaker: Lunkbug
88.text: Philomeen was a sapper, kept a smokepowder stash. Find it and blow that wall open, I'm begging you.

91.speaker: Lunkbug
91.text: Please - you have the powder? My Beldron will die back there. Blow up that wall, I'm begging you.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: My hands are full as it is. Ask someone else.

125.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
125.text: Please, please don't hurt my Phil, I beg you.
125.context: NodeContext: Worried you will hurt her beloved.

58.speaker: Lunkbug
58.text: Hurry. Our people won't last in that cave-in forever.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I have some explosive powder. I can use it to get them out.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: My hands are full as it is. Ask someone else.

73.speaker: Lunkbug
73.text: But didn't you say... I was so sure you'd help us...

13.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
13.text: I told you, Bug. At least Phil will be safe.

86.speaker: Lunkbug
86.text: Piss off, Laridda. Beldron will die in there, and you can't even pretend to care.

109.speaker: Lunkbug
109.text: Who? There's... there's no one else.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Excellent. I can add Philomeen's head to my collection.

166.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
166.text: But you said... oh hells. I told you, Bug!

160.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
160.text: You better not harm a damned hair on her head.
160.context: CinematicNodeContext: To playerNodeContext: Sad more than angry.

148.speaker: Astarion
148.text: High-powered explosives do sound fun, but must we waste them saving lives?

43.speaker: Wyll
43.text: The trapped gnomes won't last forever. We've got to help.

93.speaker: Gale
93.text: Let's give them a hand, shall we? Only decent course of action, if you ask me.

142.speaker: Lunkbug
142.text: I'm... I'm sure Beldron can give you something once he's out. Please, just listen.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: Fear not, gnome. I will protect you. Tell me what you know.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: To protect the innocent is my call. Trust me. I won't fail you.

7.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
7.text: I - all right. Go ahead, Lunkbug. Tell her.
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda pauses then nods at Lunkbug

38.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
38.text: Lunkbug, shush. Don't mind him - just telling stories. We'll have True Soul Nere out in no time.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda flashes Lunkbug a scowl, then addresses player.

8.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
8.text: Nothing. Just stories, I swear it.

32.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
32.text: Please, stay your cane. We'll have True Soul Nere out in no time.

118.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda looks scared.NodeContext: Terrified of barbarian.

14.speaker: Lunkbug
14.text: We're d-digging fast as we can. On our honour.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Listen - I can help you. Act frightened, or you'll draw suspicion.

138.speaker: Lunkbug
138.text: Praise Ironhand. Laridda - our prayers are answered!

42.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
42.text: Just keep digging. We don't want any trouble.

173.speaker: Player
173.text: Recite a gnomish call to action. 'Carpa bal' - 'Together, mighty.'

176.speaker: Lunkbug
176.text: Laridda. They speak the maxim. They can help.

159.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
159.text: Meaningless words, Lunkbug - that's all they are. Now get back to digging.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: You can trust me - I'm friendly.

143.speaker: Lunkbug
143.text: Laridda. We're hardly overburdened with friends down here. Let's hear them out.
143.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to LariddaNodeContext: Gently urging his companion to trust us.

53.speaker: Lunkbug
53.text: Beldron's trapped with that maniac Nere. If you won't find Philomeen, I will.

17.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
17.text: Forget the smokepowder - there could be more slavers out there. You'd draw them right to her!

98.speaker: Lunkbug
98.text: We're working as we can. Very hard indeed.

55.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at playerNodeContext: Tensing up
